content.description: Start on the obvious ledge move up and to the left into the center of the boulder. A few good lockoffs and you're to the top. The crux is moving into the hold that has a small tree growing out of it.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter.
content.location: It is a boulder up on the cliff band up and left of the boulder I call the Nedge Boulder.

climbs.name: Taking Lives With Oak Leaf Knives

content.description: The crux is the top out.
content.location: This is the far right arete on the boulder just right of entry.

content.description: The crux is the top out, it is chossy.
content.location:
In cavern as you enter, the Entry Boulder. The top out goes right and out of the cavern. It is left of "

Taking Lives With Oak Leaf Knives

" (V7).

content.description: This is a fun traverse with a mix of crimps, slopers, underclings, sidepulls, and a dyno topout crux. Start left in a small sitting cave.
content.location: This is on the Entry Boulder, use a sit start on the far left side in a huge hole.

content.description: This is a cave problem that is kinda hard not to dab.  It starts with both hands on a small rail and works out the entrance. The crux is keeping your feet on. fun!
content.location:
It's behind

The Hive

, behind the main two boulders on the right side. There are a few boulders laying on top of each other. It's on the left as you go up the hill.

content.description: The crux is the top out.
content.location: This is on the far left arete of the entry boulder.

content.description: Start on a huge ledge down low, mantle onto it take a nap, and then move on up on rails and crimps. This is a great problem, but it is hard not to dab, since there is a rock directly behind it.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder as

Gummerson

.

content.description:
Between the cave and the

V7

there are some nice holds that slant up and left to an insecure, slabby topout.
content.location: It is 10 feet right of the cave entrance just right of a large tree.

content.description: This is a face climb on a slab.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder as "

The Hive

."

content.description: I first climbed at these boulders in 2007 when I was living up at the campground for the summer. I moved a bunch of big rocks from the start of the crack so you could get down in there to start. I didn't see much sign of anyone climbing it before me.... Who knows? This is a nice crack boulder problem that traverses for about 25-30'. It starts finger size and goes to hand size!
content.location: As you take the trail down from the road and walk up to the front side of the biggest boulder, go through the cave in center...if I remember right, and around to the back side.

content.description: This is an easy arete, the feet are decent.
content.location:
Go past the "

Taking Lives With Oak Leaf Knives

", and go under two boulders resting on each other and go right.

content.description: Gummerson starts on the left arete sitting, work out right into the middle, put your feet up, and do a super balancy move to a big crimp. It's fun.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter.
content.location: When going to Cougar Land, stop at the gate that is closed in the winter. Park and the boulder is up on the right side about 30 or forty feet from the road.
